sourceDesc.p: Produced from collation output prepared in batch file processing on 2023-07-10 08:09:49.458611 .
Edited to correct alignments and prepared for the Frankenstein Variorum spine on 2023-07-12T22:36:45.6088636-04:00.

rdgGrp.n: ['', '<del>ten minutes</del>', '', '<del> half a quarter of </del>', '<del> half </del>', 'an', 'hour']
['agony', 'that <damage type="inkblot">fa</damage>intly reminds of the anguish of the recognition .']
['agony,', '', 'that faintly reminds me of the anguish of recognition.']
['you, <del>but</del> you will be hanged when the next session comes on –', 'however', 'that', 'is']
['you; but you will be hung when the next sessions come on.']
['', 'that wait miserably pent up only to be let loose in a world replete with <del>whrect</del> wretchedness.', '']
['than desire to remain in a world which to me was replete with wretchedness.']
['than remain miserably pent up only to be let loose in a world replete with wretchedness.']
['say – it was not untill a day or two after your illness that i thought of examining your dress']
['say—<p-end/> <p-start/>"immediately upon your being taken ill, all the papers that were on your person were brought me, and i examined them']
['say—<p-end/> <p-start/>"it was not until a day or two after your illness that i thought of examining your dress,']
['endeavoured, by dwelling on these subjects so interesting to my heart, to raise my desponding spirits; but he soon felt that a prison cannot be the abode of cheerfulness.', '"what']
['told me that he had not communicated my imprisonment to my cousin but merely mentioned my <del>he</del> illness—and', 'what']
['i was on in the orkney islands']
['happiness; and thought, with melancholy delight, of my beloved cousin; or longed, with a devouring maladie du pays , to see once more the blue lake and rapid rhone, that']
['happiness;', '<zone eid="c57-0130__left_margin"/>my beloved cousin and the blue lake which']
['to <del>prevent</del> restrain <mdel>my</mdel> <mdel>me</mdel> me from committing some dreadful act of violence.']
['to restrain me from committing some dreadful act of violence.', '<p-end/>', '<p-start/>']

['to restrain me from committing some dreadful act of violence.<p-end/> <p-start/>yet one duty remained to me, the recollection of which finally triumphed over my selfish despair. it was necessary that i should return without delay to geneva, there to watch over the lives of those i so fondly loved; and to lie in wait for the murderer, that if any chance led me to the place of his concealment, or if he dared again to blast me by his presence, i might, with unfailing aim, put an end to the existence of the monstrous image which i had endued with the mockery of a soul still more monstrous. my father still desired to delay our departure, fearful that i could not sustain the fatigues of a journey: for i was a shattered wreck,—the shadow of a human being. my strength was gone. i was a mere skeleton; and fever night and day preyed upon my wasted frame.<p-end/> <p-start/>still, as i urged our leaving ireland with such inquietude and impatience, my father thought it best to yield. we took our passage on board a vessel bound for havre-de-grace, and sailed with a fair wind from the irish shores.', 'it was midnight. i lay on the deck, looking at the stars,']
['machinations', '', "<del>and who is <del>'", '', 'to be the', '</del-inner> next victim i exclaimed</del>', 'and']
['misery', '–', 'it was midnight, my father slept below in the cabin and i lay on the deck looking at the stars']
['misery.', '<p-end/>', '<p-start/>', 'it was midnight. my father slept in the cabin; and i lay on the deck, looking at the stars,']

['restlessness, awoke me; the dashing waves were around: the cloudy sky above; the fiend was not here: a sense of security, a feeling that a truce was established between the present hour and the irresistible, disastrous future, imparted to me a kind of calm forgetfulness, of which the human mind is by its structure peculiarly susceptible.']
